speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: SCENE II. A hall in the castle.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Enter HAMLET and HORATIO

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So much for this, sir: now shall you see the other;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You do remember all the circumstance?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Remember it, my lord?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, in my heart there was a kind of fighting,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That would not let me sleep: methought I lay

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Worse than the mutines in the bilboes. Rashly,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And praised be rashness for it, let us know,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Our indiscretion sometimes serves us well,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: When our deep plots do pall: and that should teach us

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: There's a divinity that shapes our ends,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Rough-hew them how we will,--

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: That is most certain.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Up from my cabin,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My sea-gown scarf'd about me, in the dark

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Groped I to find out them; had my desire.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Finger'd their packet, and in fine withdrew

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To mine own room again; making so bold,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My fears forgetting manners, to unseal

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Their grand commission; where I found, Horatio,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O royal knavery!--an exact command,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Larded with many several sorts of reasons

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Importing Denmark's health and England's too,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With, ho! such bugs and goblins in my life,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That, on the supervise, no leisure bated,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, not to stay the grinding of the axe,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: My head should be struck off.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Is't possible?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Here's the commission: read it at more leisure.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But wilt thou hear me how I did proceed?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I beseech you.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Being thus be-netted round with villanies,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Ere I could make a prologue to my brains,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They had begun the play--I sat me down,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Devised a new commission, wrote it fair:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I once did hold it, as our statists do,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: A baseness to write fair and labour'd much

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How to forget that learning, but, sir, now

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It did me yeoman's service: wilt thou know

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The effect of what I wrote?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Ay, good my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: An earnest conjuration from the king,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As England was his faithful tributary,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As love between them like the palm might flourish,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As peace should stiff her wheaten garland wear

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And stand a comma 'tween their amities,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And many such-like 'As'es of great charge,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That, on the view and knowing of these contents,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Without debatement further, more or less,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He should the bearers put to sudden death,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Not shriving-time allow'd.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: How was this seal'd?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, even in that was heaven ordinant.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I had my father's signet in my purse,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Which was the model of that Danish seal;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Folded the writ up in form of the other,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Subscribed it, gave't the impression, placed it safely,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The changeling never known. Now, the next day

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Was our sea-fight; and what to this was sequent

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou know'st already.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: So Guildenstern and Rosencrantz go to't.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Why, man, they did make love to this employment;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They are not near my conscience; their defeat

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Does by their own insinuation grow:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: 'Tis dangerous when the baser nature comes

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Between the pass and fell incensed points

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of mighty opposites.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Why, what a king is this!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Does it not, think'st thee, stand me now upon--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He that hath kill'd my king and whored my mother,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Popp'd in between the election and my hopes,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thrown out his angle for my proper life,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And with such cozenage--is't not perfect conscience,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To quit him with this arm? and is't not to be damn'd,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To let this canker of our nature come

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In further evil?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: It must be shortly known to him from England

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What is the issue of the business there.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It will be short: the interim is mine;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And a man's life's no more than to say 'One.'

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But I am very sorry, good Horatio,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That to Laertes I forgot myself;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: For, by the image of my cause, I see

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The portraiture of his: I'll court his favours.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But, sure, the bravery of his grief did put me

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Into a towering passion.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Peace! who comes here?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Enter OSRIC

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Your lordship is right welcome back to Denmark.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I humbly thank you, sir. Dost know this water-fly?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: No, my good lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thy state is the more gracious; for 'tis a vice to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: know him. He hath much land, and fertile: let a

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: beast be lord of beasts, and his crib shall stand at

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the king's mess: 'tis a chough; but, as I say,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: spacious in the possession of dirt.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Sweet lord, if your lordship were at leisure, I

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: should impart a thing to you from his majesty.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I will receive it, sir, with all diligence of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: spirit. Put your bonnet to his right use; 'tis for the head.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: I thank your lordship, it is very hot.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, believe me, 'tis very cold; the wind is

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: northerly.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: It is indifferent cold, my lord, indeed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But yet methinks it is very sultry and hot for my

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: complexion.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Exceedingly, my lord; it is very sultry,--as

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: 'twere,--I cannot tell how. But, my lord, his

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: majesty bade me signify to you that he has laid a

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: great wager on your head: sir, this is the matter,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I beseech you, remember--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: HAMLET moves him to put on his hat

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Nay, good my lord; for mine ease, in good faith.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Sir, here is newly come to court Laertes; believe

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: me, an absolute gentleman, full of most excellent

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: differences, of very soft society and great showing:

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: indeed, to speak feelingly of him, he is the card or

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: calendar of gentry, for you shall find in him the

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: continent of what part a gentleman would see.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, his definement suffers no perdition in you;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: though, I know, to divide him inventorially would

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: dizzy the arithmetic of memory, and yet but yaw

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: neither, in respect of his quick sail. But, in the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: verity of extolment, I take him to be a soul of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: great article; and his infusion of such dearth and

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: rareness, as, to make true diction of him, his

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: semblable is his mirror; and who else would trace

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: him, his umbrage, nothing more.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Your lordship speaks most infallibly of him.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The concernancy, sir? why do we wrap the gentleman

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: in our more rawer breath?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Sir?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Is't not possible to understand in another tongue?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: You will do't, sir, really.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What imports the nomination of this gentleman?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Of Laertes?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: His purse is empty already; all's golden words are spent.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Of him, sir.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: I know you are not ignorant--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I would you did, sir; yet, in faith, if you did,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: it would not much approve me. Well, sir?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: You are not ignorant of what excellence Laertes is--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I dare not confess that, lest I should compare with

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: him in excellence; but, to know a man well, were to

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: know himself.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: I mean, sir, for his weapon; but in the imputation

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: laid on him by them, in his meed he's unfellowed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What's his weapon?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Rapier and dagger.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That's two of his weapons: but, well.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: The king, sir, hath wagered with him six Barbary

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: horses: against the which he has imponed, as I take

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: it, six French rapiers and poniards, with their

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: assigns, as girdle, hangers, and so: three of the

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: carriages, in faith, are very dear to fancy, very

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: responsive to the hilts, most delicate carriages,

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: and of very liberal conceit.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What call you the carriages?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I knew you must be edified by the margent ere you had done.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: The carriages, sir, are the hangers.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The phrase would be more german to the matter, if we

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: could carry cannon by our sides: I would it might

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: be hangers till then. But, on: six Barbary horses

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: against six French swords, their assigns, and three

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: liberal-conceited carriages; that's the French bet

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: against the Danish. Why is this 'imponed,' as you call it?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: The king, sir, hath laid, that in a dozen passes

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: between yourself and him, he shall not exceed you

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: three hits: he hath laid on twelve for nine; and it

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: would come to immediate trial, if your lordship

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: would vouchsafe the answer.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How if I answer 'no'?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: I mean, my lord, the opposition of your person in trial.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, I will walk here in the hall: if it please his

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: majesty, 'tis the breathing time of day with me; let

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the foils be brought, the gentleman willing, and the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: king hold his purpose, I will win for him an I can;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: if not, I will gain nothing but my shame and the odd hits.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Shall I re-deliver you e'en so?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To this effect, sir; after what flourish your nature will.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: I commend my duty to your lordship.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Yours, yours.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit OSRIC

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He does well to commend it himself; there are no

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: tongues else for's turn.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: This lapwing runs away with the shell on his head.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: He did comply with his dug, before he sucked it.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thus has he--and many more of the same bevy that I

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: know the dressy age dotes on--only got the tune of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: the time and outward habit of encounter; a kind of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: yesty collection, which carries them through and

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: through the most fond and winnowed opinions; and do

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: but blow them to their trial, the bubbles are out.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter a Lord

speaker: Lord
text_entry: My lord, his majesty commended him to you by young

speaker: Lord
text_entry: Osric, who brings back to him that you attend him in

speaker: Lord
text_entry: the hall: he sends to know if your pleasure hold to

speaker: Lord
text_entry: play with Laertes, or that you will take longer time.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I am constant to my purpose; they follow the king's

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: pleasure: if his fitness speaks, mine is ready; now

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: or whensoever, provided I be so able as now.

speaker: Lord
text_entry: The king and queen and all are coming down.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: In happy time.

speaker: Lord
text_entry: The queen desires you to use some gentle

speaker: Lord
text_entry: entertainment to Laertes before you fall to play.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: She well instructs me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Exit Lord

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: You will lose this wager, my lord.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I do not think so: since he went into France, I

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: have been in continual practise: I shall win at the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: odds. But thou wouldst not think how ill all's here

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: about my heart: but it is no matter.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Nay, good my lord,--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: It is but foolery; but it is such a kind of

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: gain-giving, as would perhaps trouble a woman.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: If your mind dislike any thing, obey it: I will

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: forestall their repair hither, and say you are not

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: fit.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Not a whit, we defy augury: there's a special

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: providence in the fall of a sparrow. If it be now,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: 'tis not to come; if it be not to come, it will be

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: now; if it be not now, yet it will come: the

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: readiness is all: since no man has aught of what he

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: leaves, what is't to leave betimes?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Enter KING CLAUDIUS, QUEEN GERTRUDE, LAERTES, Lords, OSRIC, and Attendants with foils,  and c

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Come, Hamlet, come, and take this hand from me.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: KING CLAUDIUS puts LAERTES' hand into HAMLET's

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Give me your pardon, sir: I've done you wrong;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But pardon't, as you are a gentleman.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This presence knows,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And you must needs have heard, how I am punish'd

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: With sore distraction. What I have done,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That might your nature, honour and exception

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Roughly awake, I here proclaim was madness.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Was't Hamlet wrong'd Laertes? Never Hamlet:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If Hamlet from himself be ta'en away,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And when he's not himself does wrong Laertes,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Then Hamlet does it not, Hamlet denies it.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Who does it, then? His madness: if't be so,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Hamlet is of the faction that is wrong'd;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: His madness is poor Hamlet's enemy.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Sir, in this audience,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Let my disclaiming from a purposed evil

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Free me so far in your most generous thoughts,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That I have shot mine arrow o'er the house,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And hurt my brother.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I am satisfied in nature,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Whose motive, in this case, should stir me most

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To my revenge: but in my terms of honour

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I stand aloof; and will no reconcilement,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Till by some elder masters, of known honour,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I have a voice and precedent of peace,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: To keep my name ungored. But till that time,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I do receive your offer'd love like love,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: And will not wrong it.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I embrace it freely;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And will this brother's wager frankly play.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Give us the foils. Come on.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Come, one for me.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll be your foil, Laertes: in mine ignorance

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Your skill shall, like a star i' the darkest night,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Stick fiery off indeed.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: You mock me, sir.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: No, by this hand.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Give them the foils, young Osric. Cousin Hamlet,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: You know the wager?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Very well, my lord

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Your grace hath laid the odds o' the weaker side.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I do not fear it; I have seen you both:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: But since he is better'd, we have therefore odds.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: This is too heavy, let me see another.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: This likes me well. These foils have all a length?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They prepare to play

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Ay, my good lord.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Set me the stoops of wine upon that table.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: If Hamlet give the first or second hit,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Or quit in answer of the third exchange,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Let all the battlements their ordnance fire:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The king shall drink to Hamlet's better breath;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And in the cup an union shall he throw,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Richer than that which four successive kings

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: In Denmark's crown have worn. Give me the cups;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And let the kettle to the trumpet speak,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The trumpet to the cannoneer without,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: The cannons to the heavens, the heavens to earth,

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: 'Now the king dunks to Hamlet.' Come, begin:

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: And you, the judges, bear a wary eye.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come on, sir.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Come, my lord.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: They play

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: One.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: No.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Judgment.

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: A hit, a very palpable hit.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Well; again.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Stay; give me drink. Hamlet, this pearl is thine;

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Here's to thy health.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Trumpets sound, and cannon shot off within

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Give him the cup.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I'll play this bout first; set it by awhile. Come.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: They play

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Another hit; what say you?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: A touch, a touch, I do confess.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Our son shall win.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: He's fat, and scant of breath.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Here, Hamlet, take my napkin, rub thy brows;

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: The queen carouses to thy fortune, Hamlet.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Good madam!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Gertrude, do not drink.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: I will, my lord; I pray you, pardon me.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: [Aside]  It is the poison'd cup: it is too late.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I dare not drink yet, madam; by and by.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Come, let me wipe thy face.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: My lord, I'll hit him now.

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: I do not think't.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: [Aside]  And yet 'tis almost 'gainst my conscience.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Come, for the third, Laertes: you but dally;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I pray you, pass with your best violence;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I am afeard you make a wanton of me.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Say you so? come on.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: They play

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Nothing, neither way.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Have at you now!

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: LAERTES wounds HAMLET; then in scuffling, they change rapiers, and HAMLET wounds LAERTES

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: Part them; they are incensed.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Nay, come, again.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: QUEEN GERTRUDE falls

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Look to the queen there, ho!

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: They bleed on both sides. How is it, my lord?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: How is't, Laertes?

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Why, as a woodcock to mine own springe, Osric;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I am justly kill'd with mine own treachery.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: How does the queen?

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: She swounds to see them bleed.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: No, no, the drink, the drink,--O my dear Hamlet,--

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: The drink, the drink! I am poison'd.

speaker: QUEEN GERTRUDE
text_entry: Dies

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O villany! Ho! let the door be lock'd:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Treachery! Seek it out.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It is here, Hamlet: Hamlet, thou art slain;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: No medicine in the world can do thee good;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: In thee there is not half an hour of life;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: The treacherous instrument is in thy hand,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Unbated and envenom'd: the foul practise

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Hath turn'd itself on me lo, here I lie,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Never to rise again: thy mother's poison'd:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: I can no more: the king, the king's to blame.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The point!--envenom'd too!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Then, venom, to thy work.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Stabs KING CLAUDIUS

speaker: All
text_entry: Treason! treason!

speaker: KING CLAUDIUS
text_entry: O, yet defend me, friends; I am but hurt.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Here, thou incestuous, murderous, damned Dane,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Drink off this potion. Is thy union here?

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Follow my mother.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: KING CLAUDIUS dies

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: He is justly served;

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: It is a poison temper'd by himself.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Exchange forgiveness with me, noble Hamlet:

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Mine and my father's death come not upon thee,

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Nor thine on me.

speaker: LAERTES
text_entry: Dies

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Heaven make thee free of it! I follow thee.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I am dead, Horatio. Wretched queen, adieu!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: You that look pale and tremble at this chance,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: That are but mutes or audience to this act,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Had I but time--as this fell sergeant, death,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Is strict in his arrest--O, I could tell you--

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But let it be. Horatio, I am dead;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Thou livest; report me and my cause aright

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To the unsatisfied.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Never believe it:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: I am more an antique Roman than a Dane:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Here's yet some liquor left.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: As thou'rt a man,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Give me the cup: let go; by heaven, I'll have't.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O good Horatio, what a wounded name,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Things standing thus unknown, shall live behind me!

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: If thou didst ever hold me in thy heart

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Absent thee from felicity awhile,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: And in this harsh world draw thy breath in pain,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: To tell my story.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: March afar off, and shot within

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: What warlike noise is this?

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: Young Fortinbras, with conquest come from Poland,

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: To the ambassadors of England gives

speaker: OSRIC
text_entry: This warlike volley.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: O, I die, Horatio;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: The potent poison quite o'er-crows my spirit:

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: I cannot live to hear the news from England;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: But I do prophesy the election lights

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: On Fortinbras: he has my dying voice;

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: So tell him, with the occurrents, more and less,

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Which have solicited. The rest is silence.

speaker: HAMLET
text_entry: Dies

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Now cracks a noble heart. Good night sweet prince:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And flights of angels sing thee to thy rest!

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Why does the drum come hither?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: March within

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Enter FORTINBRAS, the English Ambassadors, and others

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Where is this sight?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: What is it ye would see?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: If aught of woe or wonder, cease your search.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: This quarry cries on havoc. O proud death,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: What feast is toward in thine eternal cell,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: That thou so many princes at a shot

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: So bloodily hast struck?

speaker: First Ambassador
text_entry: The sight is dismal;

speaker: First Ambassador
text_entry: And our affairs from England come too late:

speaker: First Ambassador
text_entry: The ears are senseless that should give us hearing,

speaker: First Ambassador
text_entry: To tell him his commandment is fulfill'd,

speaker: First Ambassador
text_entry: That Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead:

speaker: First Ambassador
text_entry: Where should we have our thanks?

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Not from his mouth,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Had it the ability of life to thank you:

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: He never gave commandment for their death.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: But since, so jump upon this bloody question,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: You from the Polack wars, and you from England,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Are here arrived give order that these bodies

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: High on a stage be placed to the view;

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And let me speak to the yet unknowing world

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: How these things came about: so shall you hear

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Of carnal, bloody, and unnatural acts,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Of accidental judgments, casual slaughters,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Of deaths put on by cunning and forced cause,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And, in this upshot, purposes mistook

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Fall'n on the inventors' reads: all this can I

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Truly deliver.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Let us haste to hear it,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: And call the noblest to the audience.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: For me, with sorrow I embrace my fortune:

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: I have some rights of memory in this kingdom,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Which now to claim my vantage doth invite me.

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Of that I shall have also cause to speak,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: And from his mouth whose voice will draw on more;

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: But let this same be presently perform'd,

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: Even while men's minds are wild; lest more mischance

speaker: HORATIO
text_entry: On plots and errors, happen.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Let four captains

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Bear Hamlet, like a soldier, to the stage;

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: For he was likely, had he been put on,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: To have proved most royally: and, for his passage,

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: The soldiers' music and the rites of war

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Speak loudly for him.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Take up the bodies: such a sight as this

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Becomes the field, but here shows much amiss.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: Go, bid the soldiers shoot.

speaker: PRINCE FORTINBRAS
text_entry: A dead march. Exeunt, bearing off the dead bodies; after which a peal of ordnance is shot off
